Sim

Class SimBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sim.SimBoard

  • public class SimBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that creates the board and handles anything board related.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimBoard(int width, int height, int sides)
      If we are making a board then we have to specify the width and height of the board, we also have to specify if it is square or hexagonal board.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Field> getBoard()
      Returns the whole game board, no idea why you would even want this.
      Field getField(int x, int y)
      Returns the field at given positions.
      int getHeight()
      Tell you how many fields downwards the board has.
      int getSides()
      Returns what type of board we have.
      int getWidth()
      Tell you how many fields across the board has.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimBoard

        public SimBoard(int width,
        int height,
        int sides)
        If we are making a board then we have to specify the width and height of the board, we also have to specify if it is square or hexagonal board. If wrong sides is given, then you will get an exception.
        Parameters:
        width - How many fields across the board will have.
        height - How many fields downward the board will have.
        sides - Use QConstants to specify hexagonal or square board.

    • Method Detail

      • getSides

        public int getSides()
        Returns what type of board we have.
        Returns:
        Type of the board corresponding to the QConstants.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Tell you how many fields across the board has.
        Returns:
        How many fields across the board has.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Tell you how many fields downwards the board has.
        Returns:
        The height of the board.

      • getField

        public Field getField(int x,
             int y)
        Returns the field at given positions.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the field.
        y - The y position of the field you want.
        Returns:
        The field at specified coordinates (hexagonal is also like square really if you think about it).

      • getBoard

        public java.util.List<Field> getBoard()
        Returns the whole game board, no idea why you would even want this.
        Returns:
        Fields on the whole game board.
